definition: to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to replace (a worn-out tire etc)/to change (one's address etc)
to exchange/to replace/to substitute for/to switch
to obtain (sth) in exchange/to exchange (sth) for (sth else)
to replace sb (personnel, sports team player etc)/substitution
to switch over/to switch modes or data streams/to cut (to a new scene)
to change train (plane, bus etc)/transfer between modes of transport
to transform/to convert/to vary/to alternate/a transformation
to transition to a new dynasty or regime/to replace an older product with an upgraded, new-generation one

sentences.english: They cant change a light bulb or without making a sketch.
sentences.chinese: 他们连灯泡都不会换，或者至少要先画个草图。

sentences.english: Do you think it's possible for me to change to a single room with a bath?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我有可能换到一间有卫浴设备的单人房吗？

sentences.english: But you can exchange it for an international one at the sole agent's office.
sentences.chinese: 但你可以换取一张国际保用证，要到总代理那里去换。

sentences.english: Take them back and exchange them for another recommended pair of running shoes.
sentences.chinese: 把他们拿回去，拿他们换另外一双推荐的跑步鞋。

sentences.english: Glasgow I changed trains for Greenock.
sentences.chinese: 我在格拉斯哥换火车去格林诺克。

sentences.english: So they kept switching workers every couple of months.
sentences.chinese: 所以，他们才坚持每隔两三个月就换一茬工人。

sentences.english: Perfect husbands switch careers in their mid-50’s.
sentences.chinese: 完美的丈夫在50几岁换工作。

sentences.english: Peter is a black sheep of his family. He sold his house for drinking.
sentences.chinese: 皮特真是个败家子，卖了房子换酒钱。

sentences.english: There's no such thing as bad weather, just soft people.
sentences.chinese: 没有换天气这回事，只有软蛋。

sentences.english: Change the Zink block of cathodic Protection.
S: Yes, you can. Bring your card and receipt to replace it at Lao Jie Station.
sentences.chinese: 可以拿收据到老街地铁站换。

sentences.english: So do all who live to see such times, but that is not for them to decide.
sentences.chinese: 当局者迷，你可能并不知道该是换新工作的时候了。

sentences.english: B: No, but if they are defective, you can exchange them for another pair.
sentences.chinese: 不行，但要是鞋子有瑕疵，你可以换另一双。

sentences.english: Concentrate on their faces and it's like watching furry handymen changing a plug.
sentences.chinese: 看它们的脸就像是个干杂活的在换插头。

sentences.english: So I have gone through at least seven different casts of people.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我至少换了七批不同的演员。

sentences.english: I thought they have already changed the toner cartridge this month.
sentences.chinese: 我想他们这个月应该是换了墨盒了。

definition: to exchange (sth) for (sth else)/to replace with/to convert into
to replace with sth new/to upgrade
to exchange/to replace/to substitute for/to switch
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
to replace sb (personnel, sports team player etc)/substitution

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
